update.description:
Oculus support in Gazebo will be provided as an optional feature. You will need to install the Oculus SDK that will provide libOculusVR.so and OVR.h, among other header files.

How to test it:

* Install Oculus SDK.
* Add the following content to ~/.gazebo/gui.ini:

```
#!c++

[oculus]
x=0
y=0
visual=camera::link::visual
autolaunch=0
```
* Execute:

```
#!C++

gazebo ../worlds/camera.world
```
* Click on Window->Oculus Rift.

Alternatively, you can set:
```
#!c++

autolaunch=1
```
and run:
```
#!C++

gazebo ../worlds/camera.world
```

Here is a [test build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/518/console).

You can use [this tutorial](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials/?tut=oculus) for testing the pull request.
update.title: Oculus Rift support

content.raw:
Why is this method commented out? Also, if it is to remain commented, there is a code_check.sh whitespace recommendation:
~~~
gazebo/rendering/OculusCamera.hh:130:  Should have a space between // and comment  [whitespace/comments] [4]

~~~
content.html:
Why is this method commented out? Also, if it is to remain commented, there is a code_check.sh whitespace recommendation:

gazebo/rendering/OculusCamera.hh:130:  Should have a space between // and comment  [whitespace/comments] [4]

content.raw: Comments addressed, give it a try and let me know if you have any suggestion.
content.html: Comments addressed, give it a try and let me know if you have any suggestion.

content.raw: You're totally right. I changed the code a little bit and there are no exceptions in OculusCamera (4361ae7)
content.html: You're totally right. I changed the code a little bit and there are no exceptions in OculusCamera (4361ae7)

content.raw: I was trying to prevent the oculus window to appear if the headset is not plugged in. If I call `this->oculusWindow->show()`, the window always appears.
content.html: I was trying to prevent the oculus window to appear if the headset is not plugged in. If I call this->oculusWindow->show(), the window always appears.

content.raw: Doxygen for these and all the OVR attributes below.

content.raw: "UserRight" may be too generic. Could we call it "OculusUserRight".
content.html: "UserRight" may be too generic. Could we call it "OculusUserRight".

content.raw: I noticed that OVR sends messages to console. Does this line control if console messages are generated, and where they are sent to?
content.html: I noticed that OVR sends messages to console. Does this line control if console messages are generated, and where they are sent to?

content.raw: Contextual information sent to `gzlog` would be useful.
content.html: Contextual information sent to gzlog would be useful.
